metadata.title: Lines and Angles for Kids
metadata.description: Interactive questions to build understanding of basic geometry concepts
metadata.author: Math Educator

questions.question: What is a point in geometry?
questions.explanation: A point is an exact location with no size - we represent it with a dot.

questions.question: Two different points can be at the exact same location.
questions.explanation: Each point has its own unique position in space.

questions.question: Which of these represents a point?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 100'><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='3' fill='black'/><line x1='100' y1='30' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='150' y='30' width='40' height='40' fill='none' stroke='black'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The small black dot on the left is how we represent a point.

questions.question: A line segment has:
questions.explanation: A line segment is part of a line between two points.

questions.question: The line segment between points A and B is written as ____.
Which figure shows a line segment?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 100'><line x1='30' y1='50' x2='70' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='30' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrowhead)'/><line x1='130' y1='50' x2='170' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The first figure shows a line segment between two points.

questions.question: A straight line:

options.text: Goes on forever in both directions

questions.explanation: Lines continue infinitely in both directions.

questions.question: Two different lines can intersect at more than one point.
questions.explanation: Two different straight lines can intersect at only one point.

questions.question: Which figure represents a line?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 100'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='7' refX='9' refY='3.5' orient='auto'><polygon points='0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7' fill='black'></polygon></marker><marker id='dot' markerWidth='5' markerHeight='5' refX='2.5' refY='2.5' orient='auto'><circle cx='2.5' cy='2.5' r='2.5' fill='black'></circle></marker></defs><line x1='30' y1='50' x2='70' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'></line><circle cx='30' cy='50' r='3' fill='black'></circle><circle cx='70' cy='50' r='3' fill='black'></circle><text x='25' y='50' text-anchor='end' dominant-baseline='middle' font-size='12' fill='black'>A</text><text x='75' y='50' text-anchor='start' dominant-baseline='middle' font-size='12' fill='black'>B</text><line x1='100' y1='30' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' marker-start='url(#dot)'></line><line x1='130' y1='50' x2='170' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5'></line></svg>
questions.explanation: The figure with arrows at both ends represents a line extending infinitely.

questions.question: A ray has:

options.text: One endpoint and goes forever in one direction

questions.explanation: A ray starts at a point and continues infinitely in one direction.

questions.question: A ray starting at point A and passing through point B is written as ____.
Which figure shows a ray?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 100'><line x1='30' y1='50' x2='70' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='50' x2='170' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrowhead)'/><line x1='30' y1='80' x2='170' y2='80' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-start='url(#arrowhead)' marker-end='url(#arrowhead)'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The figure with one endpoint and one arrow represents a ray.

questions.question: An angle is formed by:

options.text: Two rays with a common endpoint
Three points in a straight line

questions.explanation: An angle is made when two lines or rays meet at a common point called the vertex.

questions.question: All angles are measured from 0° to 100°.
questions.explanation: Angles can measure up to 360° (a full circle).

questions.question: Which part of this angle is called the vertex?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 200'><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='150' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='3' fill='red'/><text x='80' y='120' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='40' y='40' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='160' y='40' font-size='12'>C</text></svg>
questions.explanation: The vertex is point A where the two lines meet.

questions.question: A straight angle measures:
questions.explanation: A straight angle forms a straight line and measures exactly 180°.

questions.question: A straight angle looks like a perfectly straight line.
questions.explanation: When two rays point in exactly opposite directions, they form a straight line (180°).

questions.question: Which angle is a straight angle?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='100' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='50' x2='150' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='50' x2='250' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='50' x2='250' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The first angle forms a straight line (180°).

questions.question: An acute angle measures:
questions.explanation: Acute angles are sharp angles smaller than 90°.

questions.question: An angle measuring 45° is an ____ angle.
Which angle is acute?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='70' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='70' x2='100' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='70' x2='200' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='70' x2='180' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='70' x2='300' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='300' y1='70' x2='300' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The second angle is smaller than 90°, making it acute.

questions.question: An obtuse angle measures:
questions.explanation: Obtuse angles are wider than right angles but less than straight angles.

questions.question: An angle measuring 100° is obtuse.
questions.explanation: 100° is between 90° and 180°, so it's obtuse.

questions.question: Which angle is obtuse?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='70' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='70' x2='100' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='70' x2='200' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='70' x2='220' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='70' x2='300' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='300' y1='70' x2='300' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The second angle is wider than 90° but less than 180°, making it obtuse.

questions.question: A reflex angle measures:
questions.explanation: Reflex angles are the larger angles that measure more than 180° but less than 360°.

questions.question: A 270° angle is a reflex angle.
questions.explanation: 270° is between 180° and 360°, so it's reflex.

questions.question: Which angle is reflex?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 200'><path d='M50,100 L100,100 A50,50 0 1,1 100,150 Z' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M150,100 L200,100 A50,50 0 0,1 200,50 Z' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The left angle is the larger portion (more than 180°), making it reflex.

questions.question: Perpendicular lines intersect to form:
questions.explanation: Perpendicular lines always cross at 90° right angles.

questions.question: Which pair of lines is perpendicular?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 300 100'><line x1='50' y1='30' x2='50' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='30' y1='50' x2='70' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='30' x2='150' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='130' y1='30' x2='170' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='30' x2='250' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='230' y1='70' x2='270' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The first pair forms perfect right angles (90°).

questions.question: An angle bisector:

options.text: Splits the angle into two equal parts

questions.explanation: A bisector divides an angle into two equal smaller angles.

questions.question: The angle bisector of a 90° angle creates two 45° angles.
questions.explanation: 90° divided by 2 equals 45° for each new angle.

questions.question: Which line is the angle bisector?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 200'><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='150' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='100' y2='20' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='150' y2='150' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The red dashed line perfectly splits the angle into two equal parts.
